Title: Endless Enigma
Credits: Created by Akira Shemansky for CMPM 120 using code by Adam Smith (amsmith@ucsc.edu).

Start.Body: You wake up in what looks like the ruins of a castle, a patch of light warming your face. You have no memory of where you are or what has happened, but you can still recall your mission: kill the Warlock.

Main Hall.Body: You're standing in the castle's main hall. Sunlight is streaming in through holes in the ceiling. There is a large door to the north and doorways to the east and west. The south has been blocked by debris.

Main Door.Body: A pair of grand stone doors stands before you, their frame and faces intricately carved. Three slots are arranged vertically down the middle of the doors: one rectangle, one hexagon, and one diamond. You can't see any other way to open them.

Southeast Room.Body: You walk through the doorway to the southeast. The walls are heavily cracked; they look like they're barely holding the ceiling up. You could possibly destroy them with your sorcery.

BarrierChoices.Text: Blast the wall to your left

Blast Left Wall.Body: You point your open palm at the wall and focus your energy. An explosion of blue flame destabilizes the wall, but the barrier on the other side holds it up just long enough for you to escape. Once you're out of the room, the barrier gives out and the ceiling finally caves in.

Southwest Room.Body: You walk through the doorway to the southwest. There are several pedestals holding different runes. You're not sure how, but you know only one of them is real. Which do you take?

Take Hexagon Rune.Body: You grab the Hexagon rune, and all the others disintegrate.

Southwest Fail.Body: As you reach out to grab the rune, it dissipates into thin air, and you sink into the ground. You land back in the main hallway. It seems that wasn't the right option.

Northeast Room.Body: You walk through the doorway to the northeast. An arcane barrier bisects the room, tethered to the floor, ceiling, and two of the walls. The wall to your right looks damaged, but the barrier still holds.
Northeast Room.AltBody: You walk through the doorway to the northeast. The barrier has dissipated, allowing you to pass through.

Pool.Body: You walk into a room with a large swimming pool in the center. Infused crystals still light the inside the pool, giving its surface an eerie glow. Chunks of stone float on the water, including the diamond rune.

Take Diamond Rune.Body: You don't know why, but you feel that you shouldn't step into the water. Instead, you use the floating stones as platforms to get to the rune. After you grab it from the water, the surface underneath it appears to bubble. On a closer look, small, clear fish seem to be leaping from the water. They inhabit this pool, and you immediately understand them as dangerous, though you don't know why.

Northwest Room.Body: You walk through the doorway to the northwest. A rectangular rune sits on a pedestal opposite of the doorway. To your right, the phrase "THE CLOCKS SPIN BACKWARDS" is written in blood on the wall. This phrase seems familiar to you.

Take Rectangle Rune.Body: You take the Rectangle Rune and turn back. For some reason, this is all strangely familiar, like you've done this before. You can't help but wonder whose blood is on the wall.

Insert the Runes.Body: You insert the runes into the slots one by one. After a couple seconds, all three split down the middle, and the grand doors open outward, revealing a spiral staircase leading down. Somehow, you know the warlock is just down those stairs, yet you can't feel excited. It's all too familiar.

Descend.Body: It's not just a feeling. Walking down the staircase, it's obvious that you've been here before, done this before. You can tell exactly how long you need to keep walking before you reach the doors to the Warlock's chamber. It's inevitable. With each step, you try to build up courage, but you can't muster up any feeling. You feel no fear. It just is what it is. You approach the doors to the Warlock's chamber.

Warlock's Chamber.Body: You push open the doors. The Warlock is sitting in the center of the room, mutated into something inhuman. Its torso is horribly bloated and its limbs elongated and bony. Its neck has also lengthened considerably, and its head is covered by long, silver hair, save for a dragon-like snout poking out. Even as it's squatting down, it's several times larger than you. As it notices you, you're given little time to react.

Warlock's Chamber 2.Body: You dodge to the left as it whips its arm down where you were standing, striking with enough force to shake the entire castle. You're stiff for a second, not just because you recall needing to dodge to the left, but also because you recall dying to that very strike. The Warlock readies another attack.

Warlock's Chamber 3.Body: Before it can strike, you rush in, conjuring a blade of energy, and slash the Warlock's leg. It screeches in pain. You back off as it swings its body around wildly. More memories return to you, allowing you to see ahead; previous fights here have shown you the path to take.

Warlock's Chamber 4.Body: You continue to follow your movements, all the while memories of your deaths flash before you. You remember, at the start of your task, thinking that defeating the Warlock would be near impossible, so you sought after a spell that could ensure victory. As you continue to dodge and strike, you realize that spell must have been one to send you back in time upon death, giving you a chance to try again.

Warlock's Chamber 5.Body: But where were your memories? Activating a spell like that at your skill level, you may have needed an extra condition to make it work, possibly your own memories. Both you and the Warlock begin to tire, yet your continue fighting. You recall more and more deaths, hundreds, maybe even nearing a thousand. You worry that memories weren't a condition for that spell, that the amount of deaths and returns have begun to affect you.

Warlock's Chamber 6.Body: Suddenly, the memories stop. You've surpassed every previous attempt, and now you stand in the present. The Warlock is heavily wounded, and your body burns from exhaustion. You try to think of your next move, but the Warlock has already begun its next attack!
